Emergency Aid (AE) is a financial benefit granted by the Federal Government and aims to provide emergency protection in the face of the crisis caused by the Coronavirus pandemic, according to Law 13.982/20. The AE and its extension were finalized in December 2020.    Decree 10.661/21 , which regulates Provisional Measure 1.039/21 , establishes Emergency Aid 2021 to deal with the public health emergency of international importance arising from the coronavirus. Brazil is a very large, diverse country with varying medical resources, both private and public, throughout the country. Please verify turn-around time with your chosen lab before taking the test. Express results within 2-4 hours are available in many locations at an increased fee, including in the Guarulhos International Airport in Sao Paulo and GaleÃ£o International Airport in Rio de Janeiro. Testing is available in the private sector without a doctorâs prescription, but a prescription may be required for insurance payment.   In the public healthcare system, each Brazilian state has its own COVID-19 testing plan. We recommend that you contact local/state authorities for more information. Typically, a COVID-19 test is ordered by an emergency room physician and then sent to a public lab. Turnaround time is much slower and can take up to seven days, but tests are generally free. Some states do free, drive-through testing, but this tends to be arranged ahead of time via appointment.
